column1: TODAY: Join me LIVE at 6 p.m. EST for an important discussion on the status of COVID-19 in Michigan. https://t.co/I5mM355ScG

Join me LIVE tomorrow at 6pm for a Coronavirus Virtual Town Hall where I will be joined by health experts to answer your questions on mandates in Michigan the status of relief in Congress and steps we can take to protect ourselves and our families during the holidays. https://t.co/I5mM355ScG

Discussing the need for COVID relief is critical but we must move forward with certifying the vote on Monday as the law requires.  We all need to work together to protect our democracy and not attack it’s fundamental pillars. https://t.co/rIJFpwHJln

I am listening to these COVID numbers. Landing from DC. Picking up food. Settling into the house for the week. Zoom will be my preferred method of meeting. The numbers absolutely assure that Thanksgiving is me alone at home zooming those I love. – D2

These numbers should scare everyone of us. COVID is real. We may be tired but it isn’t. PLEASE everyone one of us has a job to do. It’s next victim maybe someone you love or care about. Wear your masks keep your distance and wash those hands!   https://t.co/4o0JywywZs

Join me LIVE for an important discussion on the status of the Coronavirus. I will be available to answer your questions on mandates in Michigan the status of relief in Congress & steps we can take to protect ourselves & our families.   Register here: https://t.co/OyxaT2eEui https://t.co/WhlVKPvGdC
COVID will be the unwelcome guest at the table this Thanksgiving if Americans do not reimagine their celebrations this year.   https://t.co/mses4uY0KO

Americans with disabilities and in group homes face unique challenges due to COVID-19. The Senate must pass the Heroes Act which includes my provision supporting home and community-based services through Medicaid to provide them a lifeline and help caregivers during this time.

MICHIGANDERS: Download the MI COVID Alert app today and begin receiving notifications if you have come in contact with COVID. We must slow the spread of COVID & save lives. Download the app now! https://t.co/tklRxBsuFx
As the US reaches 250k deaths due to COVID Trump continues tweeting lies about voter fraud. Not a single mention of the families that have lost their loved. Disgraceful.

Over 250K Americans have lost their lives from COVID. Lives have been lost – loved ones who won’t ever have the benefit of a vaccine. They are gone leaving holes in the lives of their friends & families. Wear your mask keep your distance & wash your hands. Lives depend on it.

A new at-home #COVID test has been approved by the FDA. The Lucira test will enable Americans to test themselves at home from start to finish in 30 min. This is a big step in our efforts to crush COVID by aiding in the expansion of widespread testing.   https://t.co/fehSHKqio3

💼 Unemployment Assistance 🏠 Eviction Moratorium 👩‍🎓 Student Loan Forbearance   These are just a few things Americans will lose at the end of the year if Congress doesn’t come together now & pass comprehensive #COVID relief   https://t.co/gyF1o2p14J

Congrats @SpeakerPelosi @LeaderHoyer & @WhipClyburn on your reelections to lead the House in the new Congress! I look forward to working with you on #COVID relief for families expanding access to health care coverage & building a clean energy economy for our children.

Dr. Scott Atlas' tweet over the weekend was irresponsible dangerous and utterly offensive. As our nation reaches over 10M cases & over 245K deaths due to COVID Dr. Atlas should focus on containing the virus & saving lives not making implicit calls for violence.

.@GovWhitmer has been a strong determined leader throughout the #COVID health crisis. Her response to COVID has been based on the advice of scientists & health experts. Even when her own safety was threatened Gov Whitmer continued to put the health & safety of Michiganders first

Yesterday Michigan reported 8516 cases & 118 new deaths from #COVID. Cases are continuing to spike & deaths are on the rise. People’s lives depend on all of us wearing our masks physically distancing avoiding crowds and washing our hands.

Michigan’s top health official warns of a grim winter for Michigan as #COVID cases skyrocket throughout the state. It is so important for us to wear a mask social distance avoid crowds and wash our hands.  https://t.co/oZxGillv5Z
Michigan united and triumphed over a deadly pandemic in 1918. It’s time for us to do the same now. We must crush #COVID.  https://t.co/by96tLhNCR

With the #COVID health crisis putting pressure on health systems worldwide child vaccinations are on the decline. We must not lose the years of progress that have been made to protect children from preventable illnesses like #pneumonia. #ChildHealthWeek #WorldPneumoniaDay

Hospitals are nearing capacity in Michigan and many are reporting an increase in COVID deaths. I am asking all my neighbors to mask up keep your physical distance and wash those hands!   https://t.co/RlSu9aNCVO

Pfizer has announced 90% efficacy in their ongoing COVID-19 #vaccine trials. This is great news! But as we await a vaccine to be ready for the public we must continue wearing our masks physically distancing & washing those hands!    https://t.co/HAYjIuSe7N

President-Elect Biden is already demonstrating the leadership Americans need & deserve from their president. Together with a science-based approach we will contain & crush the deadly COVID-19 virus.   https://t.co/Myv62h7qPy

The U.S. has reached over 9 million cases of COVID-19 & cases are continuing to spike throughout the country. It’s past time for the Trump Administration to develop & implement a plan to crush this deadly virus before it takes more lives.   https://t.co/8jl0E85rTz

7716 Michiganders have lost their lives to the deadly #coronavirus. It’s more important than ever to mask up socially distance and avoid crowds. We must contain this virus to save countless American lives & the economy.   https://t.co/0mnnMEixli
States need funding now! It’s critical we provide them the tools they need to rapidly distribute a #COVID vaccine and keep Americans healthy.   https://t.co/s3w3O77cXr
The Dearborn School District has approved a plan for children to safely return to school once COVID-19 conditions improve in the area.   Read more details of the plan here: https://t.co/PlLlpgJiOM
Over 1000 people died of #COVID yesterday. This administration is out of touch and in denial.    https://t.co/3oQS8ScYrW

Even with the reported increase in #GDP we have not regained all the ground lost since the beginning of the #coronavirus pandemic and many Americans are still suffering significant losses in income.   https://t.co/rC1cNRbbeb
Why does President Trump continuously mislead the American people on the threats of the COVID-19 pandemic? https://t.co/BpnVBwVBYW

Hospitals across the country are beginning to reach capacity. We must wear our masks practice social distancing and avoid large gatherings so we can control the spread of #COVID and save lives! https://t.co/5fVAMMbqX1
It’s past time to pass comprehensive assistance for American’s and businesses trying to recover from the economic impact of COVID. https://t.co/aVaNJjifS2
WATCH LIVE: A Tale of Two Pandemics -- Providing Domestic Violence Services During COVID-19  https://t.co/IG53JM68GU

This weekend the @MINationalGuard will assist with no-cost COVID-19 testing in #DearbornHeights.   No registration is required.   Saturday and Sunday Oct. 10-11 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. (both days) @HypeAthletics 23302 W. Warren Avenue Dearborn Heights

During COVID everyone deserves the opportunity to be a tourist in their own community. The Refuge is a critical service to the Downriver community and a place for all to appreciate the outdoors. https://t.co/SFjEZ2lGpS
#slowthespread of COVID and get tested this weekend. Two testing sites in the 12th district have free testing this weekend. Find out more here: https://t.co/DpD0ukdGmp

Republicans have failed the American people plain and simple. They failed to take COVID-19 seriously from the start and as a result millions have been sickened and millions more are out of work. The American people are tired of waiting for Republicans to do their job. https://t.co/mQoAx8TE6t

Another example of how Republicans have failed the American people? The deficit is projected to grow to $3.3 trillion this year because of Republicans' mismanagement of the COVID-19 pandemic. This hurts our economy and American workers. #FailThePeople https://t.co/atr7YNNPho

Republicans have failed the American people during this pandemic. 200000 American lives have been lost. The U.S. leads in confirmed COVID-19 cases. This is unacceptable. #FailThePeople https://t.co/rn1HbcVgcN
Free COVID Testing in Ypsi on Saturday: Saturday September 26 from 9 am to 1 pm Ypsilanti District Library 5577 Whittaker Road  Register at: https://t.co/eac4ZlMnxU https://t.co/8aysIMeHDF

Anyone who wants or needs a COVID test can get one free of charge this weekend in Taylor.   On Saturday September 26 and Sunday September 27 from 10 am to 3 pm at the Taylor Sportsplex  https://t.co/ZUGhTnvr87

COVID-19 has shown the dangers of healthcare tied to work. Millions are unemployed meaning millions are without health insurance.   Join me and @RepJayapal for a conversation on how we can make Medicare for All a reality in this country.   Tune in here: https://t.co/RAWEdivdM4
Years from now our country will ask this one simple question: if the President acted on the knowledge he had in February about the dangers of COVID-19 would thousands of lives been saved?

In January I asked the Administration what steps they were taking to keep the American people informed on ways to prevent the spread of COVID-19.  We now know the President not only downplayed the information the Administration knew but lied to every American to better himself.

State budgets have been destroyed. If a COVID-19 relief bill isn't passed soon state funding for schools and infrastructure will be depleted. Now is the time for governance and leadership not inaction.

For thousands of unemployed Michiganders this is good news but does not offer a long-term solution to those in need. What Michiganders need is long-term assistance which starts with the President & the Senate working with House Democrats on a bipartisan COVID-19 relief package. https://t.co/9KMOZxuWuX

40% of COVID deaths have been residents and workers in long-term care settings.   My legislation which was included in the House-passed Heroes Act would provide the resources necessary to help those in long-term care settings get the care they need.   We need the Senate to Act.

Recent FDA changes are making it hard for hospitals to use plasma to treat COVID-19 that's already donated. @RepFredUpton and I are calling for urgent action from @US_FDA to clarify what is safe and let doctors do their jobs. https://t.co/3CjsbEqQdl
Mr. President — If you spent less time attacking people (and watching TV) and more time addressing COVID-19 we could beat this pandemic together. https://t.co/v7y1PsHtwZ

As National Health Center Week comes to an end we recognize the importance of health centers across the nation. They've been invaluable in the fight against COVID-19 & re-shined a vital light on the invaluable role healthcare workers play in our society. https://t.co/dmmTuOsmQc

The President and Senate Republicans had nearly 3 months to pass COVID-19 relief legislation. Instead they did nothing. Now millions of Americans could lose their homes because of their failure to act responsibly.

Affordable Housing & affording rent is a crisis for millions of Americans.  Join me State and Washtenaw County officials for a discussion on ways we can ensure individuals and families have a home to stay in during the COVID-19 pandemic.  Watch here: https://t.co/AaourVXq1P https://t.co/bai49kvllh

Fisher House is a home away from home for the families of veterans and active duty military when their loved ones receive care at the VA. Today I stopped in at the Ann Arbor Fisher House to check in on the new facility and see how it’s holding up during COVID-19. https://t.co/0P7sUPMvCV

Affordable Housing & affording rent is a crisis for millions of Americans. Join me & State & Washtenaw County officials tonight for a discussion on ways we can ensure individuals and families have a home to stay in during the COVID-19 pandemic.  RSVP: https://t.co/x7zKyZDEzY https://t.co/xZj91VBAlk

Affordable Housing & affording rent is a crisis for millions of Americans. Join me & State & Washtenaw County officials on Wednesday for a discussion on ways we can ensure individuals and families have a home to stay in during the COVID-19 pandemic.  RSVP: https://t.co/x7zKyZm3Iq https://t.co/7m6yztcLxR

40% of COVID deaths have been residents and workers in long-term care settings.   My legislation which was included in the House-passed Heroes Act would provide the resources necessary to help those in long-term care settings get the care they need.   We need the Senate to Act.

The truth is that the House passed a COVID relief package months ago. The Senate & the White House are now just showing up. People are struggling not knowing how they will put food on the table. If the White House wants to place blame anywhere they better look at themselves.

Before Medicare and Medicaid the poor the elderly and the disabled in America were forced to fend for themselves. To be old poor and sick was to suffer and to die prematurely.   Today we are seeing that with COVID.   It’s time to expand healthcare and pass Medicare for All.

Today House Democrats will stand alongside children & families. For years we have been in a child care crisis with families struggling to afford quality care that enriched the growth of young children. COVID-19 put a magnifying glass on the problem. Its time to provide relief. https://t.co/ZFJ1h2hYdU

The state of COVID-19 can be best described like this:    The President is calling for Governors to reopen their states while the COVID-19 Task Force has placed 21 states in the “red zone” due to serious outbreaks. There are too many mixed messages coming from the White House.
The House Democrats COVID relief package will feed people.    The Senate COVID relief package will buy weapons. https://t.co/17uv2WdvJS

In 20 minutes join me & education leaders for a discussion on COVID-19 & school safety. Teachers school staff children & families are all concerned about what the school year will look like. It’s important we have an open discussion.  Watch here➡️https://t.co/joaWy1CwIg

On July 27 join me & education leaders for a discussion on COVID-19 & school safety. Teachers school staff children & families are all concerned about what the school year will look like. It’s important we have an open discussion.  RSVP ➡️ https://t.co/jFU6ziz7UA https://t.co/4uw2Xo6Oxq

4 million people. That’s how many Americans have confirmed cases of COVID-19. And still President Trump & Congressional Republicans have no plan to protect lives & livelihoods. Pass the #HeroesAct now.

Because of Senate inaction 1.35 million Michiganders will lose at least 60% of their weekly income from unemployment. Action in Congress matters & Senator McConnell not acting sooner on a COVID-19 relief will gravely impact the hardworking men & women of Michigan & our country.

In the last 4 hours the @EnergyCommerce committee has advanced 30 bipartisan bills to the House floor that will make a real difference in people's lives. When we all work together there's so much we can do to combat COVID-19 & help the hardworking men & women of this country.
We should all be concerned that this is an attempt to politicize our COVID-19 response and undermine data being made transparent for all to see.  https://t.co/aj4uPQfKEd

Really? Would a white teenager be sent to a juvenile detention center for not completing online classes? We have an education crisis in the midst of COVID - this isn’t right – and must be addressed. https://t.co/bPRgmljagI

Joined VA Secretary @SecWilkie in MI at the John D. Dingell VA Hospital today with my colleague Rep. Jack Bergman. We all want our vets who put their lives on the line to receive the care they need & it was fun seeing my veteran friends I haven’t been able to see because of COVID https://t.co/ApfyY9PbsD
Decisions about going back to school must be made with the safety of children teachers and parents in mind. We must take seriously the current increases in COVID-19 cases.

Until there's a COVID vaccine or treatment millions will remain unemployed. We must show humanity & ensure those who are unemployed have the means to get by. It's unconscionable that President Trump & Senate Republicans want to end extended Federal unemployment benefits. https://t.co/949h0fomzb

One thing impacted by COVID was the opening of the International Wildlife Refuge Center. Yesterday I checked on its status. It reminds us to protect our natural resources & as John would say “We don’t inherit the earth from past generations we borrow it from future generations” https://t.co/7YECjMmPSY
The CDC standing up to the President's premature call to reverse safety guidelines for our schools will no doubt save lives and prevent the spread of COVID. https://t.co/sbPJbH0jX9

While the John D. Dingell Visitor Center at Refuge Gateway is closed due to COVID-19 we still wanted to offer you a glimpse of the refuge and all its beauty!   Tune in below to join us for a virtual tour! ⬇️  https://t.co/HBe2QqsdNu

Requiring international students taking online classes due to COVID-19 to leave the country or transfer to in-person classes is senseless & concerning. My district is home to thousands of international students attending Michigan universities who are dedicated to their studies. https://t.co/tb20jrjvvb

From March to June 22 Florida had 100000 confirmed cases of COVID-19. In the last two weeks Florida went from 100000 to 200000 new cases.   This virus is still out there and very real. Please wear your mask and be smart.

A report from @Everytown shows COVID-19 has had a direct impact on the rise of domestic violence. In fact in Metro Detroit calls to domestic violence hotlines are up 25%.  The Senate must reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act. Survivors of domestic violence need support now https://t.co/OhjpU6qj1P

Last year I secured hearings in the House on why we need Medicare for All. During those hearings we were warned about the dangers of tying health insurance to employment. COVID-19 has proven why it’s so dangerous.

Racial disparities when it comes to healthcare have been a reality in this country for too long. COVID-19 only put a magnifying glass on the issue. It’s why I and @RepJayapal  introduced Medicare For All in the House.   https://t.co/vlCReHhIU1

Johtasha is strong and survived COVID. But her release from the hospital is only the beginning of her recovery. We must ensure Johtasha and others recovering from COVID have the resources health care and support they need to make a full recovery.  https://t.co/59ZblPqfBx
Over 120000 Americans have died from COVID-19. Yesterday there were over 43000 new cases. The President needs to stop tweeting about TV ratings.
Why will remdesivir cost more in the US than other countries? And why does someone surviving COVID depend on whether they can afford the best drug to treat them?

Reports have shown that In the midst of COVID-19 the Great Lakes are being endangered by the EPA. Today we're demanding answers from the EPA as to why protection of the Great Lakes which supplies water to over 40 million people has been pushed to the side. https://t.co/y3kwWYzGum
Our country reported almost 38000 new COVID-19 cases yesterday. This virus is not gone no matter how much the White House wants that to be true. We need more testing. https://t.co/kH0J4JP23o

Those with special needs and others requiring care in the home and the community have been hard hit by COVID-19. My legislation which was included in the House-passed Heroes Act would provide the resources necessary to safely get them the care they need during this crisis. https://t.co/YJoFJcUdHb

African Americans represent 14% of Michigan’s population but account for 41% of the deaths and 32% of the total cases. We must do better & ensure healthcare doesn't depend on your skin color. COVID-19 didn't create a health crisis it exacerbated an existing one. https://t.co/uo4o2S0Bum
Join me @ACCESS1971 and @WDHTtv for a discussion on domestic violence and ways we can support survivors during the COVID-19 pandemic.  You can watch here:  https://t.co/gc33JcWrdh

COVID-19 continues to hurt small biz people still need extended unemployment benefits & hospitals still need support. That's why the House passed the Heroes Act over a month ago. Our nation can't wait until July for the Senate to act. Hardworking men & women still need relief.

COVID-19 has put a magnifying glass on cracks in our healthcare system.   Join me and @RepJayapal in 15 minutes for a Medicare for all Caucus Hearing on why we need Medicare for All. https://t.co/Rb8A4Os67B

COVID-19 has put a magnifying glass on cracks in our healthcare system.   Today at 12:00pm I'm hosting a Medicare for All Caucus hearing with @RepJayapal on why we need Medicare for All. RSVP below. https://t.co/Rb8A4Os67B

COVID-19 has shown us that you can't connect healthcare to employment. Millions became unemployed at no fault of their own & lost access to their healthcare. This is why we need Medicare for All & guarantee every American will have access to healthcare no matter the situation.

COVID-19 did not create a water crisis it exacerbated an existing one. We must ensure no American loses access to water during a time when hand washing is as important as ever. This can’t be done if people don’t have running water. https://t.co/QHwFhs2abe

Fast acting a science based approach and personal responsibility. That's what allowed @GovWhitmer to act fast on COVID-19 and save the lives of Michiganders. There's much our country can learn from her as we still face this pandemic. https://t.co/gAorQqQIMm

Seniors in places like nursing homes are at increased risk of COVID-19. That’s why I introduced a bill to provide more funding for individuals to receive home & community-based services. All Americans deserves the right to live with dignity in old age. https://t.co/4f5ONzWfYC

I’m live now for a telephone town hall on COVID-19. As our state enters new phases for reopening it’s important to know what those steps look like and what's being done to keep everyone safe. Join us below. https://t.co/XKtE3iaJgz

Join me in 15 minutes for a telephone town hall on COVID-19. As our state enters new phases for reopening it’s important to know what those steps look like and what's being done to keep everyone safe. Sign up below.  https://t.co/XKtE3iaJgz

Today marks a very sad milestone for our country. 100000 families friends & loved ones lost forever because of COVID-19. Take time to remember & celebrate their lives. We need to keep their spirit in our hearts & souls & in their honor do all we can to prevent more loss.

Tonight at 5:30pm I will hold a telephone town hall to answer questions on COVID-19. As our state enters new phases for reopening it’s important to know what those steps look like and legislation being worked on to provide relief. Sign up below to join. https://t.co/XKtE3iaJgz

Tomorrow at 5:30pm I will hold a telephone town hall to answer questions on COVID-19. As our state enters new phases for reopening it’s important to know what those steps look like and legislation being worked on to provide relief. Sign up below to join https://t.co/XKtE3iaJgz

Mr. President you will be visiting some of the hardest working men & women in the country. Their work is pivotal to us addressing coronavirus & keeping people safe. We hope you will wear a safety mask and follow protocol. Workers health & safety matters. https://t.co/u8yFq3WZ8P

Michigan is one of the hardest hit states by COVID-19. Now more than ever we must make sure our frontline services are provided to those most in need. The #SMARTFund will ensure Michigan can continue to provide essential services and carry on the fight against COVID-19. https://t.co/iqAjr1iJSP

The residents at U of M were proud to step up to the challenge and serve on the frontlines during the COVID-19 pandemic. It’s time the hospital administration worked with them on a contract that values the work they’ve done. https://t.co/aY9sd0Hf3Z

Every day we see the need for more action more support and more to combat the coronavirus crisis. Michigan has been hit harder than most states. We have a responsibility to act now and the Heroes Act will do just that.

Dr. Bright is right. We need a standard centralized coordinated plan to respond to coronavirus. It will require increased coordination from the White House states and scientists. The window for action is closing. https://t.co/zWGRXdQKZc

As far back as January Dr. Bright raised the alarm about the danger of COVID-19 the need for PPE vital medical supplies & begin preparation for an outbreak of the virus. Instead of listening to Dr. Bright the Admin either downplayed the risk or ignored his appeals entirely.
Dr. Rick Bright made repeated efforts to warn officials a pandemic was coming and what needed to be done to protect American people from coronavirus. Today we will hear this story.

Since the Senate said they'll go about legislative business beyond coronavirus now would be a great time for them to renew the Violence Against Women Act. The House reauthorized it over a year ago. Many survivors are now locked inside with their abuser and need support now.
If the coronavirus has taught us anything it's that we need to bring the supply chain back home. https://t.co/ldQbupgtFV

Moms are health care workers janitors grocery store and market cashiers and delivery service people child care and home care workers. They are essential to our country community and bring the strength of a mother to our fight against coronavirus. #FrontlineMoms

Our country is in the middle of the worst worker safety crisis in recent history. If we are to open the economy any time soon we must have standards in place that keep workers safe. @RepRashida & I are pushing to ensure all future coronavirus relief puts worker safety first.

Tomorrow I'll be joining a Senior TeleTown Hall on the need for affordable #COVIDdrugs. Hosted by @Peopleb4Pharma Join the conversation with @JonBowzerBauman @rweingarten @ActiveRetirees by calling (866) 976-7785 at 1pm ET. Together we say #NoPandemicProfiteering to #BigPharma!

Coronavirus has raised serious concerns for workers safety.  We can't ask workers to make the impossible choice between missing work and potentially losing their job or working in an unsafe environment.  We need workplace guidelines that put workers first now. #WhereisOSHA

Tomorrow at 5:30pm join me for a coronavirus telephone town hall. Joining me will be Lt Gov. Garlin Gilchrist to discuss Gov Whitmer’s recent executive orders & steps being taken to keep you safe. Sign up below to ensure you receive a call to join. https://t.co/bKJmTiRpc7

4. Ensure home healthcare aides - overwhelmingly people of color - have the proper equipment and resources to safely care for older Americans at home. We also must grant families adequate COVID-19 paid leave provisions to ensure they can care for loved ones as needed.

3. Place a national moratorium on evictions and utility shutoffs for the length of the COVID-19 public health emergency. This will protect older Americans particularly those in need of affordable housing from eviction or foreclosure due to COVID-19 related circumstances.

1. Guarantee access to affordable equitable & comprehensive healthcare. This means the Trump Admin must declare a special ACA enrollment period & drop their lawsuit against the ACA. Any vaccine or treatment created to address coronavirus must be affordable for ALL Americans.
THREAD: Coronavirus has taken a toll on the well-being and finances of older Americans. To better protect some of our most vulnerable citizens we must put in place the following guided principles:

Coronavirus has raised serious concerns for workers safety. We can't ask workers to make the impossible choice between missing work and potentially losing their job or working in an unsafe environment. We need workplace guidelines that put workers first. https://t.co/IidOpGJdDz

Every day we see the need for further action to combat the coronavirus crisis. Congress will continue to provide support to the American people until this invisible enemy is defeated and we can return to our normal way of life. https://t.co/fC9W3F0zZM

I joined my colleagues to urge House leadership that the U.S. Postal Service be given relief in the next COVID package and that such relief come with requirements that USPS maintain service standards and area mail processing facilities (AMPs).  (4/6)

How we handle COVID-19 requires facts. Science. Medical expertise. Experience. Not political influence.  That person is Dr. Fauci. #SaveFauci

At a time when people need to stay home and keep up washing their hands and cleaning every family must have access to running water in their homes. @RepRashida and I introduced a comprehensive federal ban on water shutoffs during the COVID-19 crisis.  https://t.co/9DYyTTtrTP
